item.title: "Ubuntu reduces PC troubleshooting in a school", by European Commission
item.description: One year ago I interviewed to Fernando Lanero of Ubuntu León about his migration from Windows XP to Ubuntu, in the school where he is working. Today, I’m glad to tell you, that he finished and it was a successful!! So successful that even the European Commission has taken it as an example! Yes! We can! You can read more here: School: open source reduces PC troubleshooting Thanks Fernando! Cheers!

item.title: Interview: Migrating a school from Windows XP to Ubuntu 14.04
item.description: The end of support for Windows XP runs a real crossroad for hundreds of educational institutions and their computer systems. Ubuntu is the change that cutting edge education needs. Fernando Lanero, for those who you don’t know, is teacher and ICT manager of Agustinos School in León (Spain). A free software activist entangled in the migration of a school with 1200 students to the Ubuntu operating system. Fernando & Costales
